articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: OH HYEON-GYU looks to be heading for the exit as he leads a Celtic clear-out. The South Korean striker, bought by Ange Postecoglou for £2million in January 2022, has become a bit-part player since the arrival of Brendan Rodgers last June. Oh, 23, has made just three league starts in his 20 appearances this season [...]
articles.title: OH LEADS CELTIC CLEAR-OUT

The Hoops paid Vissel Kobe £4.6million for the 29-year-old fans’ favourite in July [...]
articles.title: KYOGO: DOUBLE YOUR MONEY

articles.description: Claims that Newco dominated the Scottish Cup Final (made by formerly credible outlets) are clearly untrue, but although Celtic shaded all the important metrics, there was little between the sides. We had the ability to get the better of Newco in tight games all season.  Brendan Rodgers will be happy with this, but Philippe Clement [...]
articles.title: Rodgers and Clement will both be encouraged

articles.description: CALLUM McGREGOR has urged Celtic to snap up Paulo Bernardo in the summer. Bernardo, 22, has made 33 appearances in the Hoops’ double-winning season to welcome back Brendan Rodgers back to the [...]

articles.description: ADAM IDAH’S valuation appears to have TREBLED in his four months of action at Celtic. Idah has scored nine goals over the period, including, of course, the last-minute Scottish Cup winner against Philippe [...]

articles.description: CELTIC took their first steps onto the football pitch at their recently-completed ground for an intriguing fund-raising encounter on Monday, May 28 1888. articles.description: HENRIK LARSSON became a genuine Celtic legend during his glorious, mesmerising and breathtaking seven years at the club. Today, in a CQN EXCLUSIVE extract from Davie Hay’s autobiography, ‘The Quiet Assassin’, co-authored by Alex Gordon, we reveal [...]
